title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Short initial telephone interview followed by longer in person interview that included providing a presentation to multiple current employees. Presentation required significant preparation. Everyone was friendly and supportive. Enjoyed the experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with conflict and how you handled it.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Process was pretty friendly. We just talked about my research and wanted to understand more about the position. Everyone I talked to was friendly. It was a pretty great experience
Interview Questions: Why you wanna research here

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: as for an interview for graduate teaching assistant, phone interview with questions about teaching style and grades in general and followed by a teaching demonstration. simple and easy. people are nice there.
Interview Questions: what's your favorite course to teach?

title: Direct Care Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Met with the supervisor, the manager and the director of the facility. I was given a tour of the facility. It’s a locked down residential facility for adolescent females between 12-17.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weaknesses.

title: UREC Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy and very relaxing, was not stressed at all, simple, did not worry about messing up. The questions they ask are super simple maybe some thought but primarily open-ended. they explain the job well and are super fun.
Interview Questions: How would balance work and school?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: After conducting an interview via Zoom, an in-person interview was conducted with the human resources team. They were very personable and easy to converse with, and I enjoyed my interview with them.
Interview Questions: Why do you see yourself working in talent acquisition?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Vaguely impersonal, fairly easy though. I didn't feel welcome in the space was the issue. It doesn't seem like the best working environment for people of color, women, etc. though there are plenty of those in the South.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you deal with a student who had troubling views?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very convenient and easy to understand. There were no hoops to jump through and everyone was very kind and considerate of my time. Depending on the department you could start with a phone interview or in person. Either way they are not at all that bad and the entire hiring process from interview to offer acceptance/rejection is smooth and seamless.
Interview Questions: Expect specific questions about your experience as it relates to the job and be able to demonstrate some understanding of the tools the position may require.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty straightforward.  You apply for a position, get a call, complete a panel interview, meet on campus for another panel interview, and get offered.  It's a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: Graduate Community Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: The interview was around thirty minutes long but was an efficient process and asked good questions related to leadership and Housing-related background questions. However, if you have more leadership background outside of Housing those experiences still definitely qualify. Good luck!
Interview Questions: How in the past have you handled multiple competing deadlines?

title: Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going, comfortable environment and was able to fully describe the position. The team was very nice and were all actively a part of the interview process. The interview itself took about an hour.
Interview Questions: What are some skills you could bring to the university?

title: Technology Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Process was friendly and in depth. Allowed individual to show strengths to interviewer without being too complicated. Overall great experience and great job. Would most definitely apply and work for again.
Interview Questions: What are you most passionate about?

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Dallas, TX) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was well organized and detailed. The career portal lists all necessary information regarding the position a well as the salary requirements. The interview was conducted via zoom and communicated accordingly.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would build relationships with potential new students.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Is purely dependent upon your PI, mine was exceptionally forthcoming with information about his lab and members and essentially spent the time selling me the position rather than me selling myself.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in our lab?

title: Academic Advisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was a 2 step process. First was a Zoom interview with the hiring committee (5 people) where I was asked general questions about myself. The second round was an in-person interview that included a tour of the Business college, presentation to about 20 people, and another round of situational questions with the hiring committee.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who is indifferent about their education?

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: It was great, The team i met with were amazing and felt amazing just talking to them. It is a very great place to work at. The VP was also understanding and very caring
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Behavioral Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Heavy scenario based and questions went from easy to more challenging. Two or more people will interview you. They also asked about strengths and weaknesses. They give an overview of job as well. Not too hard, but review the company to have questions for them as well
Interview Questions: How would I handle a client flipping over a table?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met with professors over Zoom. Very conversational and friendly. They made sure I felt comfortable. They asked me about my previous research projects, research interests, and professional goals to match me with an appropriate professor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research interests

title: Graduate TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: More of an application on what you would like to study and who you would like as your advisor. It's more informal speaking to your future advisor before applying than formal.
Interview Questions: What discipline are you interested in?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: It was solid inversive over all that did a good job of asking me technical and professional questions. I felt like everyone was friendly and over all it was relaxed
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was long, spanning several months. I completed two in person interviews. The second was with several groups of people. Overall a pleasant, but very drawn out, process. I was finally offered the job but very low rate of pay, so I turned it down.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions. What is your process for grant writing? Are you familiar with citation styles?

title: TV Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Cordial interview that went through the basics of the job ahead and mostly centered on determining reliability in a work environment rather than skills for an entry-level position. Mostly standard questions that would commonly appear in any interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: All of my experiences at UA have been great and all of the staff have been very professional. Scheduling the interview was easy and organized. I was asked a few though (fair) questions! Definitely prepare well and have tons of questions to ask!
Interview Questions: What would you do if ----?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Over all very positive interview process, be prepare to talk about your self and past project based work that you have accomplished as well as leadership positions you have held
Interview Questions: What are past projects that you have worked on?

title: Mechanical Engineer REU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very clear and helpful application process. Resume and reference’s were require and the university was very quick with their decision process. Great communication with the college. Overall very good experience.
Interview Questions: Why the opportunity was of interest.

title: Research Asssistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a PhD position and most questions were primarily concerned with my general research interest, how was my interest fit/match my supervisor, what is my long-term plan and committment ?
Interview Questions: What is your research interest ? What did you do at lab XYZ ? How did you see your lab experience beneficial to your phd program ?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Initial application online which then moved to a phone interview where a select group of candidates were screened and some moved on and some were eliminated. The process ended with an in-person interview that was 1.5 hours in length. This interview was a panel style, with about 4 individuals there to ask various questions.
Interview Questions: Growth in role, plans for role

title: Student Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long and thorough.  Experience in event coordination is very emphasized. Will be going through day-long interview with students and other professional staff members and university directors and board of trustees
Interview Questions: What is my leadership style

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: easy it was really easy if you are able to work then you will be fine. it's really not difficult you will be fine. It is just time consuming with a job so make sure you will stilll be able to do your classes
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Took about 4 weeks that involved application submission to the online career database portal, phone interview with the selection committee where they asked personal questions to get to know me, on campus interview where I met with other academic advisors and professors in the program, and offer.
Interview Questions: How would you work with a student who is not motivated in their academics?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: After applying on the university career website, I received an email about scheduling a face-to-face interview. I was interviewed by three individuals for what lasted about 45 minutes. I then received a follow up email about a month later.
Interview Questions: How would you encourage diversity in this role?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: very brief. Asked my familiarity with the material and when  I would be able to work. Seems like it wasnt an interview rather than an administrative thing letting me know that I was hired
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with the material

title: Athletic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very structured and extremely comprehensive. I would recommend anybody to apply for this position as I find it very helpful to the university. Roll Tide Crimson Tide.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and how can you apply them?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview with 4 faculty members. They were very kind, funny, and relaxed which made the interview process enjoyable However, the interview had some tricky questions that I was not expecting. Be prepared to think on your feet.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to keep track of school/work balance?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 Rounds: Group Interview and Individual Interview, respectively. First round required problem-solving skills in a group setting, and then, the second interview was more behavioral and more casual to understand your personality.
Interview Questions:
- How would solve a potential issue or crisis, say for example, if certain people are lost and need guidance?
- Why did you choose to apply to be an Orientation Leader?

title: Telemarketer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was professional and was not nerve wracking. All you need to do is email the call center supervisor at the beginning of each semester, or get a referral from an employee. The interviewer will just ask that you submit your resume ahead of time so she has questions prepared to ask you. It is not a long interview process and typically only involves one sit down face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would make a good addition to the Crimson Calling Center?

title: Assistant Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. Very detailed questions and scenario but overall a great experience. Recommend for students looking for part time jobs while attending school here. They are really welcoming and opening to hire current students.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked about myself and my internship experience in the past. Interviewed by three very kind ladies in the A&S college Dean's office, and had a chance to talk to one of the current student office assistants. Overall Very positive.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me About your self

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: An interview was not required for my position. I applied online on the UA job postings websites and was hired a few days after I applied, most office assistants are not required to interview.
Interview Questions: I was not interviewed

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL)
Interview Descriptions:
I spoke to a professor, had a brief interview and lab tour. I had the professor for a class, so we were acquainted. 
The interview was rather informal, and the professor gauged my professional interests and informed me about his research and his laboratory,
Interview Questions: Describe your interest in the specific area of research, and you motivation to apply for a research job

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Must be currently enrolled in graduate program
Certain positions required letter of interest to be submitted to program and clinical directors of graduate program. One student in each second year cohort would be chosen by the program and clinical directors from the applicants.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified to hold this role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: My would be supervisor and a team lead sat down in his office and talked about what responsibilities I would have, and the role I needed to fill. General 'get to know you' questions were asked, and some about a former job.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your previous job?

title: IT Technical Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Extremely straight forward. They just ask about your experience. Very easy and quick interview. They ask basic personal questions. What you want to do? What your plans for your career path are?
Interview Questions: What experience do you have, and how does it apply to this position?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Awesome easy enjoyable people to speak with they made me feel comfortable and at ease during he process even though I was really nervous. They asked about 15 questions and it took about thirty minutes
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just a short face to face interview with the manager it was in person and pretty short. The manager was very friendly throughout the entire process. You just go to the building after applying online and go through the process
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with cold calling?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online at jobs.ua.edu and after 3 weeks recieved a phone call to set up a phone interview. The 1st phone interview lasted 30 min. after 3 days I recieved another call to have a 2nd phone interview and an on-site interview. The 2nd phone call lasted 15 minutes. and 2 days later was my on-site interview which included a breakfast, a presentation (which I had to give) and another meeting
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was called in for an interview with 3 area coordinators. They asked questions about what I know about Housing and Residential and experience I have in customer service
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in customer service

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. I just applied for my program and the job came with my acceptance into the graduate program. Because I got into the school, I did not have to interview for this job, thus this question does not apply to my situation.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Community Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place at a Graduate Assistantship Day, where many departments offering assistantships gave opportunities to talk with people currently in the positions. Interviews were preplanned leading up to this day.
Interview Questions: With students from many cultures and backgrounds in the residence halls, what would you do to create a more inclusive community in your residence hall?

title: Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward interview. Not difficult, or easy. I called the Advertising Manager at the time and was able to schedule an interview within two weeks. Every person I met with  was very nice, and were passionate about what they did.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Financial Aid Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed yet professional. Asked job related questions, and what would you do if... questions. Hiring managers are very professional. Was offered a job right on the spot. They told me the pay rate and hours and I accepted the job immediately.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Entry Level Data Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was an entry level data entry position.  We went into a very large board room where 10 people sat and asked me questions.  They asked between 30 - 40 questions.  It was ridiculous. I knew 2 minutes in that I didn't want the job and had to endure another 45 minutes of mindless questioning.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to quit your current job?

title: Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online. The department hiring manager called me 2-3 weeks later to schedule an interview for the following week. Interview went relatively smoothly and lasted about one hour. Interviewers were friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict within the workplace in the past?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job, received an email the next day to schedule an interview, had the interview (which was very easy), and was notified the very next day that I had received the job. Overall, it was a very simple process. The interviewers made me feel very comfortable by describing their research concentrations to me, and then we casually discussed where I could possibly fit in.
Interview Questions: "Tell us why you want to be a research student"

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Went on the University of Alabama Job search site and found the job the interview process was average. It took around 3 weeks to hear back to have an interview then about another 2 to 3 weeks for the offer.
Interview Questions: Student background and major

title: Conference Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 on 1 very friendly explained job duties, the interview was short less than 30 min wear professional dress, would recommend being clean cut and clean shaven. one of the easier interviews Ive had. asked me if I had any question pertaining to the job and its duties.
Interview Questions: When will you be available to work

title: Editorial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: All applications must be submitted online. The recruiter in charge of that department screens the applications for department minimums met and whether or not the application is completed according to instructions. If incomplete the application is rejected. If all materials are present at the time of submittal, the packet goes on to the hiring manager. This can take weeks if not longer.
Interview Questions:
What was my most memorable ad campaign and why? 
How well do I work under pressure? 
What are some previous experiences that would help you in this job role?

title: Guitar Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL)
Interview Descriptions: No interview just got the position because I was a guitar student. The director of the Community Music School is great and they are always in need of music teachers
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Visuals Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the visuals lead and we talked in length about my previous experiences and why I might be a good fit for the job.  He asked a lot of soft-ball questions, and there were none of the typical "What is your greatest weakness?" questions.  He had me lay out a full page in InDesign in The Crimson White style.  Everything went well, and I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe your previous experiences.

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly laid back but still very professional. It took around 2 hours to fill out all the paperwork, get my uniform, and watch a kitchen safety video. We went over rules and regulations and ordered shoes from Shoes for Crews to ensure that I was safe in the kitchen. They are very nice people and would help you if you had any questions a all.
Interview Questions: They asked about my availability

title: IT Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. While I am a student and had a very extensive history, there was not much to be discussed other than my school schedule. It was short and to the point. If you work well with faculty and the staff then you will be great for this job. You meet people you wouldn't have other wise.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with computers?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, very chill group of people. Shared jokes and talked about professors, asked about my performance in school and wanted to know how long I intended in staying in Tuscaloosa.
Interview Questions: Asked how you felt about the job and the role you would have

title: Office Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really great and we spent about 45 minutes discussing the position. I didn't feel intimidated and I had a good feeling of the general position. We talked about the tuition benefit. They said that their individual office was happy to allow employees to use the benefit, however some offices preferred their employees did not take advantage of this opportunity.
Interview Questions: What was one instance where you disagreed with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty quick after the initial phone call. Was invited to come down for an in person interview. They paid for everything and were very hospitable. Was given a date of when I would hear back and I never heard anything from the department of from the human resources department. I even emailed the director who I interviewed with and HR and still didn't hear anything back about my candidacy. Ultimately they decided to hire internally. That's fine, I get it since I currently work at a college in Boston, however I find it unprofessional to not close the loop.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge you've faced with students and how you overcame it.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After attending a mandatory interest session, you will be required to attend Capstone Academy, which is a training program that is monitored and included in the interview process. After Capstone Academy, you will have a formal interview with two of the professional housing staff members. The Community Directors then pick the Resident Advisors and Freshman Advisors they want on their staff, and those individuals receive an email containing their offer.
Interview Questions: What is an experience you've had in the past where you had to deal with an issue of diversity between individuals, what did you do to deal with it, and what was the outcome?

title: IT Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview with my direct supervisor. They already knew me and the quality of my work so the interview was very short and I was hired the next day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
good. not bad. it was a nice experience. not so hard. i m a student. •	Experienced in Project Management, BI-consulting, BI Solution conceptualization, Data Integration, and Analytics in multiple business domains viz. Supply Chain/Logistics, Tour & travel, Transportation, Energy, Education, and Consumer Lending/Mortgage. 
•	Experienced in managing onshore/offshore model and worked for European and North American clients.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I heard about the job from a current employer that recommended me to the hiring manager. I applied for the position and was called in for an interview the very next day. The Interview was very professional and easy going.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online interview for returning RAs.  Recorded from home, approximately 30 minutes long. Questions were about personality, job focus, mediation experience, programming objectives, ideas and goals.  Time to answer questions was limited, but the interview could be re-recorded numerous times with one final submission.  The only issue was that you had to answer all ten questions every time you resubmitted.
Interview Questions: What are three things you would do differently next year?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by committee. It was comfortable and quick. Long process to hire, but easy to track online. Ability to meet your peers. Friendly committee and environment. x xx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx  xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions:
The office I would be working in set up a phone interview that was about 45 minutes long and behavioral/take me through your resume. Two of the people in the office were on the phone. It was very care free; a reflection of those interviewing me.
I was then brought to campus for a lunch and multiple mini-interviews with several directors in the department. The lunch was casual but large, and the time with the other interviewers were filled with the same sort of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Sharing a time I failed came from left field (at least it felt like it at the time).

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I am a work-study student assistant. When you qualify for work-study, there is a site that can you look at work-study jobs to apply for, and there is also a mandatory career fair you must attend (the career fair is where I found my job). When searching job listings online, don't bother emailing the person listed - I emailed several people and never got a reply. Instead, the best way is to call the person directly. I was basically interviewed in person at the career fair - they asked about my computer skills and my past experience working with others. Very informal - no stress at all -, and I was emailed a job offer the next day.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have in computer repair?
How do you feel about working with data and data entry?
Can you respond to to help-desk tickets in a timely manner?

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. Simple questions that were easy to answer and the interviewer never made me feel nervous. She was very friendly and made me feel comfortable despite the situation. She did most of the talking, stating what they are looking for in an employee and the basics of the job. When the interview was over, she asked did I have any questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel that you are qualified for the job?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: typical Skype interview, a few questions about you, your current research and stuff like that. Nothing really unusual. During the Skype interview they asked to make a short slide presentation about your research and then asked about some details
Interview Questions: How did you find about this position?

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of me and a few upper management sitting in a  room and speaking about what I would be doing if I were to start working for the University.
Interview Questions: What does the app you are currently working on do?

title: Support Staff- URec Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: You apply for the job online in the spring (for next fall) and in the fall (for next spring). They will contact you if they choose you for an interview. Try to make friends with a current employee who will recommend you because they get a ton of applications and it helps if you know someone. You'll hear back within a few weeks if you've been offered an interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you handled a crisis situation.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was first scheduled for an interview with support staff. It was very in depth (two pages of questions) and lasted about 45 minutes. I received a phone call the same afternoon to set up a lunch interview with the director of the program. A week later I received a phone call and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time and prioritize?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted interviewer via email. Interviewer requested my resume and portfolio. After submitting items, interviewer requested an in person interview. Conducted an interview with immediate superior, project manager, and financial manager. Was offered position at the conclusion of the interview. I took the weekend to think over the offer and accepted the following Monday. I assumed the position a week and a half later.
Interview Questions: Would you like to accept this offer?

title: Direct Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point. First you go on a tour of the facility, than they take you into a room and interview you with a panel of 3 people. Not bad but the building had a foul odor. Maybe because its old.
Interview Questions: Have you done this type of work before?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a search committee into interview on campus. Presentation was easy and mine was very in-depth but still very short (about 7 minutes). Allowed a lot of time to answer the questions that I had. If you know how to do your job, then you will not have an issue with this interview process.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your spare time?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy, simple, basic questions to gauge your knowledge. They called me back with results in less than a day. I interviewed with the full time staff, then the administrators the same day. The entire process was very fast and efficient.
Interview Questions:
what experience do you have with troubleshooting? How about Microsoft Office?

Have you dealt with a ticketing system before?

Have you done remote support before?

Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult customer and how did you handle the situation?

Biggest strength?

Biggest weakness?

title: Annual Giving Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview, was told to hear back from them in about a week. received and email that day asking to come down for an inperson interview. after flying down, being put up in a hotel, and meals provided for, and a full day interview. was told I would hear back in a week or so ... never heard anything back. even after following up with handwritten thank you notes for those on the search committee, and those who drove me to the airport.
Interview Questions: what do you think your biggest challenge would be in this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. I had taken the class I am now a TA for and the teacher offered me the job right after. All I had to do for training is attend a couple meetings to make sure I was enough of a leader and had good communication skills.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult student?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short. Since I was a student at that time, they asked what math courses I have taken and how many hours I would like to work for.
Interview Questions: what math courses I have taken

title: Alumni Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had to demonstrate a plan of action, and the competence to carry it out. Questions were asked about how portions would be implemented
Interview Questions: Where do you see this program in 3 years?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the student work fair. Received Telephone call a few days later to see if i was still interested. Very easy interview. Just came and talked about the position with hiring manager. The staff was very nice and engaging.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Huntsville, AL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process involved an initial conference call with faculty. Then I was required to create a power point presentation on a topic sent to me a week prior to the interview by the department. They flew me in to the campus. I gave the presentation then was required to meet with the vp of academic affairs then the president of the university.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process is very nice.  Interviewees take you very seriously and are very aware of the job requirements.  The time frame is pretty lengthy.  It took quite a while to hear back for final selections.  I had several friends who did not get a position as an RA and they were not told they were not selected--it was just silence.
Interview Questions: All questions were based off of the STAR method

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process at UA is very easy, if you know someone. I interned with the department for a year before I was interested in full-time employment. I knew the person who was making the hiring decision and received a call for a phone interview. The interview lasted about five minutes and the questions centered around whether or not I would work early mornings. The whole process lasted about one month. The university never does anything quickly.
Interview Questions: Will you work 4am to noon?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to a professor about the types of sciences that I was interested in, the amount of time that I would be able to work and my class schedule. It was not really an interview, but more of an introduction. He explained the work that he did in the lab and showed me some of the experiments he was working on.
Interview Questions: What do I know about the research being done.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the manager she asked a few questions about previous work experience, and availability.Suggested a start time and I was hired nothing too serious.
Interview Questions: The questions were really simple.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The biggest issue with hiring at the university is that it takes time. Expect to go long periods of time without knowing the status of your application. The interview process tends to be fairly laid back, with most of the focus being on ensuring you are a good fit for the team and the job.
Interview Questions: There is a technical component to some interviews that require you demonstrate your development abilities. Be ready to demonstrate that.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is based on the CV and university transcripts. If you have a good background and good communication with the advisor, you have a great chance to get the offer. Also, the devotion to the research in the future will be important to present during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after you graduate?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview with Administrative Assistant for the office.  Met with the Dean and other office staff to discuss skills, personal background, and job description.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, and other computer software?

title: Web Applications Develooper Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: They asked me few questions about my previous job in the University and asked about my role. The panel asked about the web application that I have developed and the functionality of the application.
Interview Questions: How could you develop the website for the CCS which serve as accepting the request and saving it?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applicants apply online, must be a student that has lived on campus before. You then get call backs based on your application. The interview process has 4 rounds. The first 3 are group interviews: situation based, personality tests, and problem solving. Students are interviewed to test each other on how they react in groups or team work. The last round is a traditional one-on-one interview with questions about why you want to be hired, etc.
Interview Questions: There was a scenario of "whose-life-would-you-save" and the interviewers watched as you presented your arguments as to how and why you would save certain people.

title: Office Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: The application process is quite easy at UA, however, it's quite difficult to be considered if you don't already work there or know someone who does. I happened to be interviewed for the temp office pool position available at the time and it was very informal. We spoke about my recent experience in grad school and my resume. It was very short and they called me back within the hour to fill out the final hiring process paperwork.
Interview Questions: I don't remember having to answer any difficult or unexpected questions for this particular job, but the one that always irritates me is: "Where do you see yourself in five years?" How in the world am I supposed to answer that? Am I psychic?

title: Student Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Alabama (Tuscaloosa, AL) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: Ned to have background in PC, windows, networks
Interview Questions: How to resolve DNS confllict
